results.title: Yaaba
results.creator_credit: Heima Film, Les Films de L'Avenir, Arcadia Films, Pierre-Alain Meier, Idrissa Ouédraogo, Freddy Denaes and Michel David
results.brief_description: Few films are as fresh and simple as “Yaaba”, even fewer come as close to perfection. Set in a few flat, sunbaked hectares around a village in Burkina Faso the story is told with the directness of fable with little dialogue, and with the four-square photography confined to three colours - brown, blue and green. The central generation gap story is enriched with incidents of village life so that a vast range of human behaviour and experience is packed in without any sense of haste or padding. The result is not an example of naive cinema but a film whose technical and aesthetic sophistication is presented with an uncloying charm.

results.title: Ya Vamos. No. 1. A Mexico
results.creator_credit: Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Joshua Tree Productions
results.brief_description: A Spanish language film. Provides some cultural background of Mexico to students learning elementary Spanish with the text “entender y hablar”. Shows Lucia Sznchez and Sara Lopez travelling throughout Mexico.

results.title: XXX
results.creator_credit: Neil H Neil H. Moritz, Revolution Studios and Rob Cohen
results.brief_description: Director Rob Cohen’s second outing with action star Vin Diesel (their first collaboration was the very successful The Fast and the furious) is a playful hybrid of the James Bond spy movies and extreme sports action. Diesel stars as adrenaline junky Xander Cage who is coerced by the US government into infiltrating a Russian crime ring based in the Czech republic that is planning, amongst other things, the destruction of the world. XXX makes no secret of its Bond appropriations. Cohen gleefully includes in the mix an evil genius based in an elaborate (and not very conspicuous) mountain lair, a beautiful but dangerous woman (Asia Argento), Russian bad guys (yes they’re still bad, irregardless of the Cold War being over), state of the art gizmos and plenty of explosions. It even alludes to the beginnings of a long standing franchise. Cast includes: Samuel L. Jackson, Marton Csokas.

results.title: XX and the unmentionable underbelly of his-story
results.creator_credit: Daniela Torsh, Australian Film Commission and Julie Cunningham
results.brief_description: An animated celebration of women’s biology, its rhythms, power and mystery. Double X presents the concept that biological differences between women and men have shaped our history. Male rituals, according to this view, evolved as a compensation for the inability to bear life. Examines the nature of time, its connections to the rhythms of the body and soul, especially signifigant when examining the role of women in pre-patriarchial society. Thus, women are seen as a creative force in pre-history, in the development of rituals and civilisation. Winner of the Fiction Category, Greater Union Awards, 1986, Sydney Film Festival.

results.title: Xplora 1: Peter Gabriel's secret world (MAC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Gabriel and Real World Multi Media
results.brief_description: There are just three things you need to keep in mind as you make your way through Peter’s world… Xplore, Xperiment, Xperience. It’s up to you to find your way on your journey. You decide which direction you want to go in. Don’t be afraid to explore - click around and find out for yourself what happens and where it takes you.

results.title: Xos: a cry for help
results.creator_credit: Roberta Chuter, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Alan Woodruff
results.brief_description: Two transvestite brothers argue over the fate of their deceased grandmother: should she be buried in the family plot, or stuffed and placed beside her favourite dog?

results.title: Xmas cruise
results.brief_description: A pictorial account of the ‘Katoomba” and her passengers among the islands of the pacific. Includes images of downtown Sydney in the 30s and 40s. Double Decker buses and trams feature. Photographed by Vin Alford.

results.title: Xanadu
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Gordon, Universal Pictures and Robert Greenwald
results.brief_description: Disco, rollerskates, ELO and 1940s meets 1980s courtesy of Olivia Newton-John and Gene Kelly combined in this cult, kitsch, musical fantasy. Kira (Olivia Newton-John) is a Greek muse despatched to Earth to inspire young artist, Sonny Malone (Michael Beck), realise his dream of starting up a disco rollerskating rink called Xanadu. She teams him up with Danny McGuire (Gene Kelly), an ex big club band member and former recipient of Kira’s magical influence. Sonny and Danny merge their styles and generations as Kira and Sonny challenge the laws of nature by falling in love. From this threadbare plot emerges a time capsule of 1980s music, fashion, and sensibility that has been simultaneously loved and loathed by viewers.

results.title: X -Ray inspection
results.creator_credit: Division of Visual Aids US Office of Education
